intro: Tylophora ovata var. lanyuensis, commonly known as the Lanyu tylophora, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, often with a slight fragrance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in mountainous regions with well-drained soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
